
 
# How to Use a Character Calculator for Divinity: Original Sin 2
 
Divinity: Original Sin 2 is a complex and challenging role-playing game that offers a lot of customization options for your character. You can choose from different races, origins, classes, attributes, abilities, talents, skills, and gear to create your own unique build. But how do you know if your build is effective and balanced? How do you plan ahead for the future levels and challenges? That's where a character calculator comes in handy.
 
**Download â€” [https://kolbgerttechan.blogspot.com/?l=2uwWla](https://kolbgerttechan.blogspot.com/?l=2uwWla)**


 
A character calculator is a tool that allows you to simulate and optimize your character build for Divinity: Original Sin 2. You can input your character's level, race, origin, weapon, attributes, abilities, talents, skills, and gear, and see how they affect your character's stats, such as damage, critical chance, armor, resistances, action points, initiative, and more. You can also compare different builds and see which one suits your playstyle and preferences better.
 
There are several character calculators available online for Divinity: Original Sin 2. Some of them are:
 
- [Divinity: Original Sin 2 - Build planner](https://divinity-2-planner.netlify.app/): This is a simple and user-friendly calculator that lets you create and share your builds easily. You can choose from the predefined origins or create your own custom character. You can also select your weapon type and see how it affects your damage and critical chance. You can allocate your attribute, ability, and talent points, and see how they impact your stats. You can also choose your skills from the full spell book and see their descriptions and requirements.
- [Updated Character Planner / Skill Calculator](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1rxGmz0_6iXFolhVNBsdG9o9YSOqMp2EY4P-YYkRzIsg/edit?usp=sharing): This is a comprehensive and detailed calculator that uses a Google spreadsheet format. You can create up to four characters and see their stats in different tabs. You can also see the effects of different talents and skills on your stats. You can also print or export your builds as PDF files.
- [DOS 2 Character Planner](https://www.nexusmods.com/divinityoriginalsin2/mods/232): This is a downloadable calculator that works with Microsoft Excel 2010 or later. You can create up to six characters and see their stats in different sheets. You can also see the effects of different weapons, armors, runes, potions, scrolls, grenades, and consumables on your stats. You can also adjust the difficulty level and see how it affects your enemies' stats.

Using a character calculator for Divinity: Original Sin 2 can help you make the most out of your character build and enjoy the game more. However, keep in mind that these calculators are not official tools and may not reflect the exact values or mechanics of the game. They are also subject to updates and changes as the game patches or mods are released. Therefore, use them as a reference or a guide, but not as a substitute for your own experimentation and experience.
